info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 12:58PM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Ogle, northeastern Lee and De Kalb Counties through 200 PM CST... At 1257 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ashton to near Mendota. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... DeKalb, Sycamore, Rochelle, Genoa, Shabbona, Cortland, Hinckley, Kirkland, Waterman, Hillcrest, Kingston, Malta, Ashton, Paw Paw, Creston, Lindenwood, Monroe Center, Lee and Steward. Including the following interstates... I-39 between mile markers 83 and 108. I-88 between mile markers 68 and 101. This includes...Northern Illinois University. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
